content: Hey so I've crafted some elementals or golems in the past this time we're gonna
craft something a bit different
I started by tearing off small pieces of XPS foam these are gonna be like small
rocks the ones that this miniature is going to be crafted out of we're gonna
start by crafting a simple and quick stone wait I made a circle and filled it
with hot glue then just applied lots of stones in it you have to be pretty quick
when working with hot glue it hardens quite quickly
I glued in a few additional stones and there we go
pretty simple the base seems to be quite sturdy I just cut off some extra glue
before moving to the next step I'm gonna make the legs now I just took a suitable
piece of foam and started shaping it by ripping off material with my deadly
claws instead of using your fingers you could
also just use a knife and rip off some material to create a rocky texture and
here is the other leg I try to shape this lower leg in such a way that it
would be easier to attach the upper legs you can also use aluminum foil to add
texture then I just glued the lower legs on I try to not place them straight so
that the miniature might have some kind of a pose when it's done by gluing in
some smaller pieces in the cracks the attachment gets stronger I was not happy
with the size of the base so I made it people
I applied the glue around the base and attached more stones
now that the base is done let's move upwards i shaped the upper legs and then
attach them with a slight angle so that it would look like the miniature has
knees now it's time for the floor so I just took a bigger piece of foam and use
the same texturing technique as before we're gonna cover this piece with
crystals later so it doesn't really matter what it looks like I checked if
it fits yep and glued it on don't worry about
the messy glue you can always take it away
again I glued in some smaller pieces to strengthen the bond this is how I made
the arms from two pieces
soon I will be attaching fingers to create a stone in hand these are the
small foam pieces I will be using for the fingers creating a hand like this is
much easier with the hot glue gun compared to using PVA glue that I
usually use and as expected some more glue the
crucial thing for this miniature is to create a goofy-looking head I carved the
eyes and mouth and then attached it to the torso in order to create suitable
pieces for the crystals I cut off corners from a piece of XPS folk as you
can see I adjusted the attachment angle of some vases
this is the fun part of the bill you just attach lots of crystals
I attached the largest crystals to the
back the elbows and the lower legs and I moved it with smaller ones on the front
of the torso and under the arms I made some diluted PVA glue but only
with a little bit of water it's still pretty thick I coated the entire
miniature with this glue when it dries the miniature will become a lot tougher
this is especially important for the themed crystals we don't want them
breaking off now it's time to paint this guy eye base painted everything except
the crystals with black if you get paint on the crystals you can still cover it
afterwards so it doesn't matter this is how it looked after painting with that I
also painted the bottom of the base with black just in case I had any unpainted
spots on the top that light would shine through I then dry brushed the black
rock with a grey
for the next layer I dry brushed with a mixture of brown and yellow
I had to apply two coats of this since it blends in with the dark background
the finish of the rod i dry brushed it
with a fan as you can see I didn't paint the base
with the brown mixture
now that the final drybrushed layer is
done we will switch over to acrylic miniature paint until now I have just
been using cheap acrylic paints the paint's I will be using our army painter
red and crystal blue the first crystals were painted in red then unmixed red
with the crystal blue to make a dark purple color the rest of the crystals
were painted with the crystal blue I then draw breasts with lighter colors
here I'm using a pale blue followed up with a white dry brush
a mostly focused on dry brushing the
edges and some pink then white
the purple crystals were drybrushed with what there's still something missing
don't you think flocking I applied diluted PVA glue then
sprinkled on some lemongrass lemongrass seems to work as flocking I then painted
the lemongrass with green and also drive rusted with yellow
here is the bass the miniature is almost done just wait for a moment
oh these actually seem to be the showcase pictures you seem to like
miniatures lucky for you I like miniatures every week so if you're new
here you should definitely subscribe these are some of the miniatures are
crafted I make tutorial videos for everything cool that I craft you should
watch every single one of them
you
